@RyMacleod A big box of free kit probably does count as a bribe doesn’t it? But what sort of self-cunting cunt would I be to say no to that?
I was sceptical of the games being any more than tech demos, but if you try Bound, and imagine a VR Mario game with similar engine… well.
Anyhow, like I say — they sent it to me, so it cost me nothing. Try before you buy. But bloody HELL that’s the future right there that is.
The Batman thing, for instance, is just remarkable. I actually had to take it off for the final scene because I was getting too freaked out.
It’s mental. It’s like DREAMING the fucking game.
… I always imagined 1st-person experiences. Didn’t *occur* to me how immersive a 3rd-person game like Bound or Tethered would be.
… bearing in mind this is the most basic home VR is likely to be it’s pretty mind-blowing. Also: when I used to picture VR...
It’s not perfect. There are 10 billion cables. It can be blurry. Clunky. Some things make you feel seasick. But...
… It reminds me of when I first saw Doom. Or Mario 64. Or fuck it, Space Invaders. A real sense that “everything just changed”.
… but none of those really prepared me for the barrage of HOLY SHIT moments I’ve had trying out the PSVR thingy...
… also I’ve tried out a Game of Thrones promotional thingy and a Stranger Things promotional thingy, both of which were v impressive...
I’ve tried Oculus Rift a few times. Eg @PaintingP used one to create a virtual ‘Tucker’s’ for San Junipero prior to the shoot...
(I often use micro gaming-sessions as a reward when writing… “If I finish the next two scenes by 11pm I can play games for 30m”, etc)
Sony sent me a PSVR headset and a bunch of games, which I’ve been trying out on-and-off in-between writing and general tinkering...
Some quick off-the-top-of-my head thoughts on VR coming, so look away now if bored shitless by your INEVITABLE FUTURE
